intro: Eriospermum tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of fleshy, woolly leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. Eriospermum tortuosum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall.
